title.narrative: COVID-19 Rural Relief Distribution in India

description.narrative: Our project is distributing staple foods (rice, pulses, mustard oil, wheat flour, potatoes, salt, sugar and soap) to migrant workers and daily wage laborers in rural India where there is limited access to essential goods during the COVID-19 lockdown.

mailing-address.narrative: My Choices Foundation, PO Box 47305, Plymouth, MN 55447, United States

description.narrative: COVID-19 is making the plight of those facing hunger much more difficult. The Global FoodBanking Network (GFN) and its food banking organizations are on the front lines in over 40 countries outside of the U.S. working tirelessly to serve those seeking hunger relief services now more than ever. GFN food banks remain rooted in communities during this crisis. We need your support to continue to build and support strong food banks that serve millions of people. Learn more at www.foodbanking.org

mailing-address.narrative: Caroline Parsons, 70 E LAKE ST STE 1200, CHICAGO, IL 60601-5915, United States

description.narrative: While responsible for delivering the majority of the world's materials to the recycling value chain, informal collectors are also critical to maintaining public health and sanitation. They are often marginalized in their own communities and have limited access to basic needs such as food, decent shelter, and healthcare. In Nigeria, the COVID-19 pandemic is deeply affecting the lives and livelihoods of the waste collector community and they need immediate support to cope with the crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: John Holm, 99 M St SE, Suite 400, Washington, DC, DC 20003, United States

description.narrative: Freedom from Fear will increase SSI's response to the spike in violence and child abuse in Botswana, Africa. The national lockdown increased stress on families and decreased access to services leading to poverty, hunger, depression & violence in the home with little to no reprieve for victims. SSI provides counselling support, food and medication delivery, homework packets, safe shelter placements for fleeing survivors and community education on Covid-19 preventative measures.

mailing-address.narrative: Lisa Jamu, 693 17th Ave, Salt Lake Cty, UT 84103, United States

title.narrative: Coronavirus Response at the Floating Villages

description.narrative: Support The Lake Clinic's efforts in continuing to provide free health care across eight floating villages on the Tonle Sap Lake during the ongoing Coronavirus Pandemic. TLC is working to prevent the spread of Coronavirus to and in these villages by teaching about handwashing and preventative measures and monitoring symptoms and tracking any cases that emerge. This project will ensure TLC's long term presence in the villages throughout COVID-19 and beyond.

mailing-address.narrative: Madeline Njos, Paradise Road, Group 6, Salakanseng Village, Svaydangkom, Siem Reap, 17252, Cambodia

description.narrative: 275 families participating in the DEHVI Foundation programs are being directly affected by the crisis we are experiencing right now due to COVID-19, causing them to fall into a situation of poverty even deeper than the one they were in before. Due to health restrictions many families have stopped receiving income, especially those who have an informal job or are in refuge status. With these donations, we will be able to support basic needs during the pandemia.

mailing-address.narrative: Connie Quesada, 8th Avenue, Between 21 and 27Ath street, next to Conarroz, San Jose, San Jose PO Box 3353-1000, Costa Rica

title.narrative: Help the World's Poorest Affected by COVID-19

description.narrative: For communities already in crisis - where health systems are weak, lacking basic equipment, and suffering severe shortages of healthcare workers - the impact of COVID-19 will be devastating. Concern is responding in 23 of the world's poorest countries, focusing on containment and prevention, mitigation of impact on food and income security, and early recovery for those affected. We need your support to provide essential supplies, public health information, and skills training.

mailing-address.narrative: Hannah Mack, 355 Lexington Avenue, 16th Floor, New York, NY 10017, United States

title.narrative: Support to Covid 19 Helpless People in Nepal

description.narrative: We are from Nepal, Nepal is Asia 's poorest country, We are in need We need your support so we can save the lives in Nepal, Due to the nationwide lock down for a month long, families' dependent on waged labors deprived from the opportunity of work, daily income. Finally, many people in very worst condition, they unable to daily meal and proper health care, This project will help the reach the food and health and safety to one thousand families. Please consider our request for donation.

mailing-address.narrative: Surait Thakur, Janakpur, Dhanusha, Province No 2, Nepal, Janakpur, +977, Nepal

title.narrative: Creating awareness about COVID 19 in Arua District

description.narrative: COVID19 pandemic in Uganda 685 cases with24 in Arua- West Nile. State of panic is a threat to community transmission. Government announced extreme lock-down measures which include; ban on public gatherings, transport and stay home to prevent the community transmission. community awareness about virus transmission, signs and symptoms, preventive measures such as social distancing, hand washing with soap, disinfecting hands, surfaces, etc, are unknown in rural poor areas with limited networks.

mailing-address.narrative: Dricile Ratib, Packwach road Box 534 Arua, Kampala, North Western 256, Uganda

title.narrative: Prevent domestic violence Pakistan during COVID-19

description.narrative: Spousal abuse and domestic violence is skyrocketing in Pakistan due to COVID-19 lockdowns, lost jobs, meltdown in economy and husbands working from home. This project fundraises to help abused women get help and sanctuary.

organisation.narrative: Dawood Global Foundation - Educate a Girl

mailing-address.narrative: Tara Dawood, G3, Ground Floor, BRR Tower, Hassan Ali Street, off I I Chundrigar Road, Karachi, Sindh 74000, Pakistan

title.narrative: Coronavirus relief for families in southern Nepal

description.narrative: Province 2 in Nepal (where we work to assist street children) has been incredibly affected by the coronavirus and the strict lockdown. Main source of income for people has been work at factories, fields and other temporary work - all of it had to stop. There is a huge amount of people from the Dalit community (untouchables) and they rely on their daily income. People with no citizenship or other paperwork cannot claim support from the government and have no access to food.

mailing-address.narrative: Julia Krepska, 1 Pelham Street, Brighton, Sussex BN1 4NA, United Kingdom

title.narrative: LGBTQ+ care and support in the Eastern Caribbean

description.narrative: In countries where same-sex intimacy is a crime, LGBTQ+ people are often last to receive support locally. Your donation will ensure food and mobile communications for vulnerable LGBTQ+ people. Many are unable to earn a living in tourism or the informal sector as COVID-19 decimates the economies of the eastern Caribbean islands. You can help ECADE and its network uphold the dignity and independence of LGBTQ+ people in the EC facing an often intolerant community.

organisation.narrative: EASTERN CARIBBEAN ALLIANCE FOR DIVERSITY AND EQUALITY (ECADE)

mailing-address.narrative: Eastern Caribbean Alliance, CONCH SHELL DRIVE, P.O. Box772, Castries, 00124, Saint Lucia

description.narrative: Many of our community members have been disproportionately impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, experiencing sudden loss of income. They are now at risk of becoming homeless, an outcome that we strive to combat. To that end, we seek to create "Roots Rapid Relief Fund," a flexible funding source to help alleviate some of the financial hardships, provide food, ensure that they do not default on rent, utility or phone bills, and that they remain housed during this devastating pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Noha Aboelata, 9925 International Blvd. #5, Oakland, CA 94603, United States

title.narrative: Covid-19 affects CM/feed babies & homeless teens

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has affected Centre Marembo (CM) and raised many problems mostly food insecurity and WASH related issues for homeless teen mothers and babies. Due to the lockdown we are experiencing, all our agriculture and livestock activities are no longer productive. This has affected our nutrition mechanism and we are aiming to reach out to 200 homeless teen mothers, their babies, pregnant teens and street girls.

mailing-address.narrative: Nicolette Nsabimanahttps://www, Ndera Sector, Kigali, 5255, Rwanda

title.narrative: Give Hope & Resilience To Youth In Kenya

description.narrative: Due to the prevailing pandemic, our youth centre remains closed, however, It is important we ensure the youth are not idle and remain positively engaged during these times of uncertainty brought by Covid-19. We have taken up remote learning doing zoom classes every day of the week. Our youth, who largely come from less privileged backgrounds are at risk and from engaging them other challenges have arisen hence we are now offering psychosocial support and food packages beyond remote learning.

mailing-address.narrative: Lucy Kimaru, Ngumo, Highview Phase 2 House no 3, Off Kemri Road, Nairobi, 00100, Kenya

title.narrative: Support 49 children w/ autism, Mex covid-19 crisis

description.narrative: Centro de Atencion para el Autism Alex IAP provides the integration of children with autism, encourages diagnosis and timely intervention through different therapies to apply inclusion at home, school and community. Educates parents on how to apply these strategies at home and create a suitable environment for the child. Provides conferences in schools and in the community, to raises awareness among the general population favoring the inclusion and independence of children with the autism.

organisation.narrative: Centro de Atencion para el Autismo Alex IAP

mailing-address.narrative: Lucila Saccone, Lago Mitla 156, Lomas de Oriente, Michoacan 61509, Mexico

title.narrative: DSCG Community Free Range Poultry Project

description.narrative: The community of Kodike majorly depends on farming and rearing birds and animals and majorly chicken and Goat's. The community of Kodike is currently facing the challenge of of scarcity of food and limited sources of income and largely contributed by the lockdown due to Corona Virus (COVID-19). However, through David Saint Care Group (DSCG) over 25 households have been helped to have a bunch of 6 birds each, i.e. 5 female hens (layers) and 1 roaster in a bid to help boost their income.

mailing-address.narrative: Asasirwe Judith, Kodike Village, Nyero Sub-County, Kumi District. P.o Box 11631, Kampala., Kampala, 256, Uganda

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response Project in Rural Nigeria

description.narrative: Epidemic preparedness and readiness is essential for every health facility and its personnel. This is a 12 weeks project designed to train community health workers on infection prevention and control in order to curb imminent community spread of COVID-19 in rural areas in Gombe state. The health workers will also be trained on how to locally make hand rubs for their facility consumption. In addition, we will support 114 PHC facilities with local hand washing stands to encourage hand hygiene.

mailing-address.narrative: Muhammad Saddiq, Suite No 2 KN and HN Plaza, Federal Lowcost Gombe, Gombe State, Gombe, 760222, Nigeria

title.narrative: Support for children of sex workers in COVID 19

description.narrative: The COVID 19 pandemic marks an unprecedented time in modern time that requires the best of humanity to overcome the crisis situation. The lock-down has drastically affected on the lives and livelihood of all categories of people in the society. Andhra Pradesh is one of the top ten states drastically affected by virus including rampant day by day increased cases and death toll. In the state of Andhra Pradesh there are nearly 60, 000 sex workers and 1,500 rescued victims from sex trafficking

organisation.narrative: Society for Help Entire Lower and Rural People

mailing-address.narrative: HELP AP NGO, 2nd lane, Sujatha nagar, Lawyerpet Extension, Ongole, 523002, India

title.narrative: Support Learning and Livelihoods during COVID-19

description.narrative: Join us as we unite to tackle the impact of COVID-19 in Kenya. We are raising funds to support families' continued learning and livelihoods. For only 2,500ksh ($25) you can help 75 households gain holistic support. Parents get help to adapt and grow their businesses. Children get engaging and fun learning activities. All of this will be delivered via a text message chatbot, at no cost to families. Help children continue learning and parents grow their businesses.

mailing-address.narrative: Amelia Phillips, 92 Morningside Avenue #7E, #7, New York, NY 10027, United States

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic and subsequent lockdown have created havoc in the lives of poor families, jobs lost, businesses shut down, fighting hunger, disease, their children are on the verge of discontinuing education. As this situation warrants an urgent response, we plan to provide the affected families with food, hygiene kits, support them to revive their businesses, motivate them to find jobs, support their children's education and equip them with skills for livelihood.

organisation.narrative: Foundation for Initiatives in Development and Education for All ( IDEA)

mailing-address.narrative: Dr. Usha Pillai, B/3, Chaitanya Society , Opp. Keshav Kunj, Brahmachaitanya Society lane, Near Ambedkar Chowk, Warje, Pune, Maharashtra 411058, India

title.narrative: Survival gardens for Zim's COVID-19 fight

description.narrative: In view of the prevailing global health crisis owing to the devastating impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, Zimconserve is initiating a project it has termed "Survival gardens" .The novel idea revolves upon the promotion of vegetable growing boxes and mandala gardens as a healthy way to counter the social distancing inhibitors that are in place to contain the escalation of the pandemic, while at the same combating malnutrition of citizens under lock-down.

title.narrative: Support Local Tech to Slow the Spread of COVID-19

description.narrative: As with many other countries, Tanzania too has been impacted by COVID-19. Twende Social Innovation Centre wants to flatten the curve by making technologies to slow the spread of the virus. According to health practitioners, handwashing destroys the virus. We have successfully tested foot-powered tippy taps, where users can wash hands without touching the tap. We need your support to bring our locally designed and built tippy taps to public hospitals, orphanages, and marketplaces in Arusha, TZ.

mailing-address.narrative: John Nzira, PO Box 14760, Arusha, 00000, Tanzania, United Republic of

description.narrative: While the whole world is looking for ways to combat COVID-19, women and girls in Sierra Leone are at particular risk. A 12-month State of Public Emergency, lockdowns, curfews and other restrictions, are a cause for great concern for the women and girls we work with. In this crisis, our provision of legal and welfare support is more vital than ever-a health crisis should not obstruct human rights. AdvocAid is working hard to ensure continuous support to women and girls in contact with the law.

mailing-address.narrative: Development Intern, 3rd Floor, 145 Circular Road, Freetown, Western Region None, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: COVID-19: Aid to indigenous Communities in Oaxaca.

description.narrative: At Una mano para Oaxaca, we are implementing resilient, quick responses and interventions in order to help the health sector and encourage people who are living through the lengthy lockdown. We are planning a long term post COVID-19 crisis programm, that allows our indigenous communities to recover from the economic recession which is already affecting deeply the local economy. The 2017 earthquake taught us that adversity is the fuel of great projects, and resilience is our best weapon.

mailing-address.narrative: Una mano para Oaxaca, 20 de Noviembre 456, Quinta Seccion., centro, Asuncion Ixtaltepec, Oaxaca 70140, Mexico

title.narrative: COVID-19 Dont Stop Us. Look To Homeless People

description.narrative: The COVID19 has hit everyone's health and economy and those living on the street have resented it even more. We have all been sent home, but what happens when your home is the street? Today more than ever we need your help to advance the work we do with youth and families who work on the street or live in public spaces. Your donation will be used to cover the payment of the personnel that attends directly to the people and to offer our services to each family and youth.

mailing-address.narrative: Gabriel Rojas, Totonacas 492, ajusco, Mexico City, Mexico City 04300, Mexico

title.narrative: Agroecological producer families in context COVID

description.narrative: In this quarantine situation due to the world health crisis caused by Covid-19, it forces us to see the leading role and the role that rural populations and especially small family farming have been playing, which for many reasons are forgotten and made invisible by decision-making authorities. Currently this sector concentrates 70% of food production for the country. The beneficiaries of the project are characterized by belonging to family farming, they depend on the predominant use the labor

title.narrative: Gender Justice Movements Addressing GBV & COVID-19

description.narrative: Global Fund for Women strengthens gender justice movements with funding and resources to create meaningful change. Amid COVID-19, women are facing increased violence, restricted access to reproductive healthcare and rights, and a heightened care-giving burden. Through our partnership with CHIME FOR CHANGE this year, Global Fund for Women will focus support on women's funds in four different countries working to advance gender justice including by addressing these challenges.

mailing-address.narrative: Sara Ferree, 800 Market St, 7th floor, San Francisco, CA 94102, United States

title.narrative: FOOD AND EDUCATION RELIEF FOR DEAF AND BLIND KIDS

description.narrative: There are many children who are deprived of basic social amenities including access to education as a result of their disability. In Ghana deaf and blind children are mostly isolated and looked down upon. The covid-19 situation has worsened their already existing situation and many of such kids are calling in for support. Its very difficult to ignore the plight of such vulnerable children when they ask for food and educational material support. In all the Project hopes to reach 1500 kids.

mailing-address.narrative: Ernest Appiah, p.o. box ad 912, Adisadel, Cape Coast, +233, Ghana

title.narrative: COVID-19 Support Fund for Sierra Leone

description.narrative: The ultimate goal of this project is to reduce morbidity and mortality due to Coronavirus (COVID-19) and to interrupt the transmission of this virus. This project will increase community awareness on the prevention and spread of the COVID-19 disease, reduce panicking and disinformation caused by the spread of the COVID-19 disease, and ensuring the supply of basic resources such as face masks, food, and shelter to the poorest and the needy.

title.narrative: Prevent the spread of Coronavirus in Liberia

description.narrative: This project will prevent the spread of Coronavirus in Liberia by engaging approximately 1 million Liberians to ensure that they know, understand and implement the Coronavirus health protocols. We will partner with 213 community-based organizations and 25 media houses to ensure the messages and spread far and wide, and to ensure direct aid (food, water, hygiene supplies) reach the most vulnerable Liberians.

title.narrative: Covid-19 Relief for Inter-Faith Filipino Children

description.narrative: In the Philippines, religious conflict and natural disasters have caused suffering for millions of Filipino children. This program provides care for children who are victims of the Covid-19 virus and other disasters. Inter-faith cooperation teaches students the value of teamwork and unity. We provide face masks, basic foods, clean water and hygiene. In response to the Covid-9 crisis, we are currently providing protection, hand-wash, and nutrition programs for more than 3,000 children.

title.narrative: COVID-19: Feed families at-risk in Mexico

description.narrative: Your project will support 150 families, who were already fighting against poverty and hunger, to meet the essential needs of food and hygiene during the closure of COVID-19 and who are also starting to catch the virus and do not have money to pay medications or medical care. Crecemos will provide nutritious and balanced meals to families, as well as hygiene and protection kits (detergent, soap and masks), will help pay for medicines and medical care for people infected between May and October.

This initiative seeks to bring food and hygiene products to 2,000 children and their families affected by the emergency of COVID -19 in Honduras. The preventive measure of absolute curfew has affected families who live thanks to the income they receive daily from activities linked to the informal economy.

title.narrative: Volmoed Retreat Centre Programs for Reconciliation

description.narrative: Volmoed is a retreat and conference centre in Hermanus, South Africa. The focus of its mission for the past 34 years is reconciliation, focused on racial reconciliation, and reconciliation within families or groups. Groups or individuals come for training programs, conferences on reconciliation, group learnings, wellness retreats, peace & to relax. Due to Covid-19, there are no visitors and no income. They are meanwhile raising funds to keep Volmoed going.

organisation.narrative: The Volmoed Trust (for Healing And Reconciliation In South Africa)

title.narrative: Support 500 women to access health care in Nigeria

title.narrative: 55 laptops for our underprivileged female students

description.narrative: Dar Moustaqbel, 'House of the Future', is our student house in Marrakech and hosts 55 girls from underprivileged families. We offer them the opportunity to attend university by offering a safe house where they can prosper. Especially for girls from poor families, it is not easy to start a study and enter the labour market. Being digitally connected is a necessity for our students, and therefore we need to invest in laptops, especially now during Covid-19.

title.narrative: COVID19 Provision of essential livelihood products

description.narrative: Under the current circumstances and as result of the COVID-19 lockdown, the lowest strata of the society, comprising of daily wage workers, agricultural coolies, workers in brick kilns, stone quarries, construction workers, contract labourers, street vendors and persons involved in lorry trade have been the worst hit. These groups have lost the only source of their income and have no means to make both ends meet or provide food for their families.

description.narrative: This project will provide our "Stop COVID-19 Community KIT" to 103 rural artisans & their impoverished families (aprox. 750 people) in 5 remote villages in stunning but isolated Atauro Island, too far away for government support. With little information, no income (no tourists to buy their handicrafts) and no soap and masks the next 2 months will be critical to avoid the spreading of COVID-19 like wild fire. We provided initial support - but now they need AID for the next 2 months.

title.narrative: Covid-19 Pandemic: Support 3000 IDPs in Kuchigoro

description.narrative: The project aims to improve the lives of about 3,000 internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Kuchigoro community, Abuja, Nigeria by donating relief materials such as food items and cloths to them. In addition, sinking of a borehole to provide portable water for proper sanitation and also sensitization of the IDPs about infectious diseases, especially during this covid-19 pandemic through the use of print media. The project has kicked off and need more fund for wider coverage.

mailing-address.narrative: Juliet Chuka, N0 84 Yakubu Gowon crescent Asokoro Abuja, Abuja, 900241, Nigeria

title.narrative: Help us keep wildlife forever wild

description.narrative: Nationwide lock-down, a shattered economy and an uncertain future- the coronavirus outbreak has brought the world to a halt. However, wild animals oblivious to lock-down or our funding challenges continue to venture into human habitations. Our teams are attending to constant wildlife displacement calls from our project sites. Moreover, orphaned individuals undergoing rehabilitation at our rescue centres require constant nurturing before they go back to the wild. We seek your help to continue.

mailing-address.narrative: Monica Verma, F-13,, Sector 8,, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201301, India

Up to now, our organization has been able to successfully deliver food supplies to around 700 families and protective masks to around 2500 beneficiaries, bringing relief to the many families in need.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Rural Food Relief - Cape Agulhas region

description.narrative: The COVID-19 lockdown in South Africa has left a large portion of our population without any means of income, very few have access to social grants and foreign nationals have no support from government institutions. The HeadStart Trust is supporting already established community initiatives in the Cape Agulhas region, through food relief. We need your help to continue a sustained supply of food to these initiatives and the communities they support.

title.narrative: Emergency Supplies to Save Cameroon from COVID-19

description.narrative: As COVID-19 spreads quickly in Cameroon, many people in the country are constantly living in fear and insecurity. With suboptimal health care conditions, the country may soon face terrible consequences. Our project - Cameroon Unites Against COVID-19 Project - will mainly take place in rural and urban areas across Northwest Cameroon, distributing educational materials (flyers, posters, T-shirts, posters) as well as personal protective equipment (soap, hand sanitizer, cloth mask) to 1,000 people.

title.narrative: COVID-19: Help us/help St Francis Hospice with PPE

description.narrative: Help St. Francis Hospice fund PPE to protect its patients, their families, staff and volunteers from the spread of COVID-19. Imagine a time when PPE is not in short supply, when patients can be with their relatives and when people will not spend the last days of their lives separated from their family. Donations will protect staff and support family members to be with their relatives at one of the most vulnerable and difficult times of their life Help fund PPE NOW!

title.narrative: Helping KMS through COVID-19 and Lockdown

description.narrative: With the COVID-19 pandemic impacting everyday life, we thank you for your continued support. Right now Kampala Music School (KMS) faces new challenges due to the impact of Lockdown and social distancing. The music school building is shut and we have had to take lessons online where possible. However, this is challenging due to network and technology challenges. Hence <10% of students are accessing lessons impacting greatly on our income and ability to pay staff and maintain KMS.

mailing-address.narrative: Julia Downing, Plot 18 Kitante Close, Kampala, N/A, Uganda

title.narrative: Around the World in 7 Days Against Covid-19

description.narrative: Around the world Rugby people on the Front Line: Fight Covid-19 : Feed those in need : Save Lives. We honour every one of them, and alongside rugby players in the Forces and Police, who lay down their lives for us every day, we will support them in a challenge to travel around the world in 7 days. Join us, support them, save lives. Travel any way you can (human powered only), log your miles, donate to the relief effort to feed children and save lives.

title.narrative: Offer A Meal In This Pandemic

description.narrative: In our community many children have been traumatized by the loss of their parents, abandoned due to extreme poverty . Mentor Orphans Africa provides shelters, food , Free Education and Healthy care to these vulnerable , orphaned children, Among these are HIV/ AIDS victims. due to the covid-19 pandemic, we cannot give basic needs due to situation changes in our country of limited movement, doubled prices.Apparently, our children feed on porridge for both breakfast and supper.

Your donation to this fund will support immediate and long-term relief and recovery in our vulnerable community during this challenging time.

mailing-address.narrative: Resa O'Reilly, PO Box 875, Christiansted, VI 00821, United States

description.narrative: We want to help keep people and children safe from Covid-19 by sharing soaps, toiletries, face masks and even clean water. Save & Nurture Child Care Foundation (SNCC) has a responsibility to the community and children to keep them save from abuse and diseases, including opening projects in communities as they become pandemic hotspots. Our COVID-19 response focuses on three main priorities: supporting authorities to provide care for COVID-19 patients; protecting children who are at risk

title.narrative: FOOD RELIEF COMMUNITY OUTREACH INTO ZANDSPRUIT

description.narrative: We are raising funds to support the poor during South Africa's Lockdown and COVID-19 crisis, in our nearby township called Zandspruit, which is home to thousands of poor people with most living in shacks and little access to basic needs. Through our partnerships and community relationships we are aiming to help families with nutritional basic food supplies, basic hygiene and cleaning products. We need all the help we can get for our poor. Thank you in advance for your generosity and support.

mailing-address.narrative: Katja Schmidt, Unit 10C, Lifestyle Riverfront Office Park, 21 Bosbok Road, Randpark Ridge, Johannesburg, Gauteng 2195, South Africa

title.narrative: Water and hygiene kits to fight COVID-19

description.narrative: The orphanages in Cameroon have no way of preventing the spread of the virus, and many of the children don't even have access to drinking water. LifeTime Projects has therefore decided to act urgently to disinfect the orphanages, hand out hygiene kits to 200 children and drill a water well in one of the homes that currently doesn't have access to drinking water. An awareness campaign is being launched to inform the children and neighboring population on how to stop the spread of COVID-19

mailing-address.narrative: Laetitia Craig, Ruche 35, 35 rue Vauban, Strasbourg, 67000, France

description.narrative: The 100s programmatic cornerstones are Mentoring, Education, Economic Empowerment, & Health and Wellness. Our COVID-19 relief efforts bridge the digital divide by ensuring disadvantaged students have (1) appropriate electronic equipment & Wi-Fi access to complete their schoolwork, (2) participate in virtual mentoring sessions & other educational enrichment, (3) provide masks for mentees, (4) host virtual town halls, & (5) provide parents who are essential workers with gift cards for necessities.

title.narrative: Fighting COVID-19 In Haiti 4 Community Justice!

description.narrative: The Grand'Anse Region is key to Haiti's food security. The 1st phase of our COVID-19 Campaign focuses on 19 villages that are most vulnerable & the lives & health of 12,600 families-about 40,000 people who, as farming families, are essential & indispensable to Haiti's economy. Haiti's Challenges: A high rate of infection 8.2% ; A dysfunctional health care system. Our 1st focus: Prevention. Our Strategy: Outreach to communities & providing residents with hygiene kits & information.

title.narrative: Act to prevent coronavirus' spread in East Africa

description.narrative: People across East Africa are on the front line of the coronavirus pandemic. Communities hampered by under-resourced healthcare systems, poor infrastructure and insecure livelihoods are struggling to prevent the spread of this disease and protect lives. Tens of thousands of people are faced with risks posed by a lack of access to health facilities combined with difficulty in securing adequate food, shelter and clean water. Health Poverty Action is working in these communities to safeguard lives.

mailing-address.narrative: Siaffa Bunduka, 31-33 Bondway, London, SW8 1SJ, United Kingdom

description.narrative: The entire world is currently battling the COVID-19 pandemic and Nigeria is not exempted from this battle. For a country designated the poverty capital of the world, many Nigerians are finding it extremely difficult to survive this period with many flouting physical distancing and other preventive measures in the scramble for survival. Obijackson Foundation with your kind support aims to provide food and medical supplies to 500 rural impoverished Nigerians and 500 front-line medical workers

In Sierra Leone, Socio-economic state of women with disabilities who are mainly single mothers is appalling. In these difficult times when lockdowns and stay home measures are instituted, women with disabilities suffered with starvation, with barely little or nothing to eat with their children. Donating to a fund that will provide food for these hungry single disable mothers will save lives.

Communities hampered by under-resourced healthcare systems, poor infrastructure and insecure livelihoods are striving to prevent the spread of this disease and protect lives. Thousands of people living in border regions are faced with the risks posed by widespread migratory working combined with a lack of access to health facilities. These items will be used to create 1,000 response packets and training materials.

title.narrative: Intervention and Response Under COVID-19 Pandemic

description.narrative: The project addresses the newly developing vulnerability of 120 poor children and families due to COVID-19 in poor communities of Addis Ababa. It includes children's educational and psycho-emotional needs while staying at home. Poor communities lack access to basic protective material. Hence, the project intends to solve the problem by distributing food items, protective materials, sanitizer, soap, provide home-based educational assistance, along with psycho-emotional and counseling services.

We have seen several children's ways of living improved. More than ever, we need your urgent assistance in continuing to help these children especially through the post covid 19 era.

The Actors Fund, a national human services organization headquartered in NYC, serves everyone in film, theater, television, music, opera, radio, and dance: through financial assistance grants, health insurance enrollment, affordable housing resources, financial wellness workshops, career counseling, and support groups for injured dancers, seniors, and addiction/recovery.

Training includes receptionist duties, housekeeping, cooking and hospitality. Provision of these skill-sets enables vulnerable youth to access varied and worthwhile career opportunities. In turn, graduated trainees and are able to live independently and support their family by sending some of their earnings back home.

After many years of living in foreign soil as refugees, they resettled in Karen State to begin their life as residents, but COVID-19 has made them more marginalized and difficult to get out from poverty. GCS will implement emergent relief to provide rice to the most vulnerable refugee families. On World Refugee Day, 20 June, we hope that you remember and support them.

Food and essentials kits - with rice, pulses, potatoes, oil, salt, biscuits, masks and soaps - will provide them with sustenance and safety while ensuring their survival.

This project proposes the development of a low complexity kit that allows quadrupling the capacity of each ventilator in a context of peak demand and saturation of the available ones. This kit may be manufactured locally in each country.

Lack of proper nutrition, has left many starving, hardly having a meal a day. This exposes them to treatment failure and increased viral load which may see more deaths even after the pandemic.
